description: Krob Kem is a crispy Thai snack made from rice flour flavored with fish sauce and herbs, giving it a savory and aromatic crunch.

title: Kratong Thong
ingredients: Rice flour+fish+vegetables
steps:
1. Fry rice flour cups until crisp.
2. Fill with stir-fried minced fish and vegetables.
3. Garnish with coriander and chili.
description: Kratong Thong is a bite-sized Thai appetizer of golden pastry cups filled with minced chicken and vegetables, both crispy and flavorful.

title: Krabong
ingredients: Pumpkin + rice flour + egg + salt + frying oil
steps:
1. Mix pumpkin with flour and coconut milk.
2. Coat evenly and deep-fry until golden.
3. Drain oil and serve hot.
description: Krabong is a crispy Thai fritter made by deep-frying vegetables in rice flour batter, popular as a street food snack.

title: Kuay Teow Lord
ingredients: Rice noodles+soy sauce+herbs
steps:
1. Steam rice noodle sheets until soft.
2. Fill with pork and herbs, then roll tightly.
3. Serve with sweet soy sauce.
description: Kuay Teow Lord is a soft rice noodle roll stir-fried with soy sauce, herbs, and pork, offering a smooth and savory flavor.

title: Kari Puff
ingredients: Flour+curry powder+potato
steps:
1. Make filling with curry powder, potato, and onion.
2. Wrap in pastry and seal edges.
3. Deep-fry until golden brown.
description: Kari Puff is a flaky pastry filled with curried potatoes and spices, combining a mild curry flavor with a crispy texture.

title: Karawek Sod Si
ingredients: Rice flour + coconut milk + pandan juice + sugar
steps:
1. Boil taro until soft.
2. Mix with coconut milk and sugar.
3. Simmer until creamy and fragrant.
description: Karawek Sod Si is a rare Thai dessert known for its colorful layers and floral aroma, often served during festive occasions.

title: Kung Ten
ingredients: Fresh shrimp + chili + lime juice + fish sauce + mint
steps:
1. Mix live shrimp with lime juice and chili.
2. Add lemongrass, mint, and fish sauce.
3. Serve immediately for freshness.
description: Kung Ten, or dancing shrimp, is a spicy Thai salad made with fresh shrimp, chili, lime, and herbs, famous for its zesty flavor.

title: Ko Kae
ingredients: Peanuts + sugar + coconut milk + salt
steps:
1. Roast peanuts until golden.
2. Coat with melted sugar and coconut milk.
3. Let cool before serving.
description: Ko Kae is a fun Thai snack of crispy peanuts coated with a savory-sweet outer layer, a popular street and store-bought treat.

title: Kai Sam Yang
ingredients: Chicken + chili + lime juice + fish sauce + coriander
steps:
1. Fry chicken until cooked.
2. Toss with chili paste, sugar, and lime juice.
3. Serve with fresh herbs.
description: Kai Sam Yang is a spicy Thai chicken salad made with herbs and chili, offering a balance of sour, spicy, and savory tastes.

title: Kanom Kui Chai
ingredients: Flour+chives+soy sauce
steps:
1. Mix flour with water to make dough and fill with chopped chives.
2. Steam until soft and cooked through.
3. Serve with sweet soy dipping sauce.
description: Kanom Kui Chai is a chewy chive dumpling made from flour and filled with seasoned chives, usually served with soy dipping sauce.

title: Kanom Kheng
ingredients: Glutinous rice flour+sugar
steps:
1. Mix glutinous rice flour with sugar and water.
2. Shape into small pieces and steam until translucent.
3. Let cool and coat with shredded coconut.
description: Kanom Kheng is a simple Thai dessert made from glutinous rice flour and sugar, soft and mildly sweet.

title: Kanom Jeeb
ingredients: Flour+pork+herbs
steps:
1. Fill dumpling wrappers with minced pork and herbs.
2. Steam until fully cooked.
3. Serve with soy and chili sauce.
description: Kanom Jeeb is the Thai version of dim sum dumplings, filled with minced pork and herbs, steamed to perfection.

title: Kanom Tokyo
ingredients: Flour+custard+sugar
steps:
1. Pour thin batter on hot pan and spread evenly.
2. Add custard or sausage filling in the center.
3. Roll up and serve warm.
description: Kanom Tokyo is a sweet Thai street snack with thin pancakes rolled around custard or sausage filling.

title: Kanom Pang Ka Kai
ingredients: Flour+sugar+butter
steps:
1. Mix flour, sugar, and butter to form dough.
2. Bake until golden brown.
3. Brush with condensed milk before serving.
description: Kanom Pang Ka Kai is a Thai-style sweet bread made with butter and sugar, often enjoyed as a breakfast or snack.

title: Kanom Pang Na Moo
ingredients: Pork+flour+herbs
steps:
1. Spread minced pork mixture on bread slices.
2. Fry until crispy and golden.
3. Serve with cucumber relish.
description: Kanom Pang Na Moo is a crispy fried bread topped with seasoned minced pork, served with cucumber relish.

title: Kanom Pak Kad
ingredients: Rice flour+vegetables+soy sauce
steps:
1. Mix rice flour with chopped vegetables and soy sauce.
2. Steam until firm.
3. Cut into small pieces and serve with soy sauce.
description: Kanom Pak Kad is a savory rice flour pancake filled with vegetables and soy sauce flavor, soft and aromatic.

title: Kanom Puang Pratad
ingredients: Rice flour + coconut milk + sugar + food coloring (for pattern)
steps:
1. Mix rice flour with coconut milk and sugar.
2. Pour onto hot pan and cook until golden.
3. Serve warm with shredded coconut.
description: Kanom Puang Pratad is a rare regional Thai dessert often prepared during temple festivals, known for its intricate design.

title: Khao Kriap Kung
ingredients: Shrimp paste+flour+herbs
steps:
1. Mix shrimp paste with flour and herbs.
2. Steam mixture until firm, then slice thinly.
3. Sun-dry and deep-fry until crispy.
description: Khao Kriap Kung is a crispy shrimp rice cracker made from shrimp paste and herbs, perfect as a light snack.

title: Khao Kriap Pak Mo
ingredients: Rice flour+pork+herbs
steps:
1. Pour thin rice flour batter on cloth over boiling water.
2. Fill with pork and garlic mixture, then wrap.
3. Serve with fried garlic and chili sauce.
description: Khao Kriap Pak Mo is a soft rice flour crepe stuffed with minced pork and herbs, offering a smooth texture and savory taste.

title: Khao Kriap Ya Na
ingredients: Rice flour+vegetables+herbs
steps:
1. Steam rice flour batter into thin sheets.
2. Wrap around stir-fried vegetables and herbs.
3. Serve with sweet soy sauce.
description: Khao Kriap Ya Na is a soft and aromatic rice flour snack filled with vegetables and herbs, often enjoyed as a light street food.

title: Khao Tom Bai Kapho
ingredients: Glutinous rice+banana+coconut milk
steps:
1. Mix glutinous rice with coconut milk and banana.
2. Wrap in banana leaf and tie tightly.
3. Steam until rice is soft and fragrant.
description: Khao Tom Bai Kapho is a traditional Thai dessert made of sticky rice, banana, and coconut milk wrapped in banana leaves and steamed to perfection.

title: Khao Tom Mat
ingredients: Glutinous rice+banana+coconut milk
steps:
1. Combine sticky rice, banana, and coconut milk.
2. Wrap in banana leaf and steam until cooked.
3. Let cool before serving.
description: Khao Tom Mat is a sweet sticky rice parcel with banana and coconut milk, commonly offered during Thai festivals.

title: Khao Tang Na Tang
ingredients: Rice crackers+coconut milk+pork
steps:
1. Fry rice crackers until crisp.
2. Make coconut dip with minced pork and coconut milk.
3. Serve crackers with warm dip.
description: Khao Tang Na Tang is a crunchy rice cracker served with warm, creamy pork and coconut dip, combining sweet and salty flavors.

title: Khao Pan
ingredients: Sticky rice + chili paste + herbs + minced fish + garlic
steps:
1. Fry herbs and chili paste until fragrant.
2. Mix with cooked rice and stir well.
3. Serve with fresh vegetables.
description: Khao Pan is a northern Thai rice dish made with herbs and chili paste, known for its earthy and spicy profile.

title: Khao Mao
ingredients: Glutinous rice+banana+coconut milk
steps:
1. Mix young rice flakes with coconut milk and banana.
2. Steam lightly until soft.
3. Serve with grated coconut.
description: Khao Mao is a sweet Thai treat made from young green rice flakes mixed with banana and coconut milk, soft and chewy in texture.

title: Khao Ho Tod
ingredients: Rice flour + coconut milk + sugar + roasted sesame seeds
steps:
1. Mix cooked rice with egg and coconut.
2. Shape into patties and fry until golden.
3. Serve warm with sugar syrup.
description: Khao Ho Tod is a crispy Thai rice snack seasoned with coconut and sugar, giving a light crunch and gentle sweetness.

title: Khao Niao Ping
ingredients: Glutinous rice+coconut milk
steps:
1. Mix sticky rice with coconut milk and sugar.
2. Shape into balls and grill until slightly crisp.
3. Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: Khao Niao Ping is grilled sticky rice mixed with coconut milk, slightly crispy on the outside and soft inside.

title: Kai Kwam
ingredients: Eggs+herbs+spices
steps:
1. Beat eggs with herbs and chili.
2. Fry until set and slightly crispy.
3. Serve with rice and fresh vegetables.
description: Kai Kwam is a spiced egg dish cooked with Thai herbs and chili, offering a warm, aromatic, and mildly spicy flavor.

title: Khrong Khrang Krop
ingredients: Rice flour+sugar+herbs
steps:
1. Mix rice flour, sugar, and herbs with water.
2. Shape into small pieces and deep-fry until puffed.
3. Cool and store in airtight container.
description: Khrong Khrang Krop is a crunchy Thai snack made from rice flour and sugar, lightly seasoned with herbs for a fragrant sweetness.

title: Khang Khao Pueak
ingredients: Taro+flour+sugar
steps:
1. Steam taro until soft, then mash well.
2. Mix with flour and sugar to form dough.
3. Shape and deep-fry until golden brown.
description: Khang Khao Pueak is a traditional Thai taro dessert made with taro, flour, and sugar. It has a crispy exterior and a soft, sweet inside, often enjoyed as a tea-time snack.

title: Kaep Moo
ingredients: Pork skin+salt+spices
steps:
1. Boil pork skin until tender, then dry completely.
2. Deep-fry in hot oil until puffed and crispy.
3. Drain and sprinkle with salt or spices.
description: Kaep Moo is a Thai crispy pork skin snack seasoned with salt and spices. Its crunchy, flavorful, and commonly paired with spicy chili dips.

title: Cho Muang
ingredients: Rice flour + butterfly pea + minced pork + coconut milk
steps:
1. Mix rice flour with butterfly pea juice for color.
2. Fill with minced pork and herbs.
3. Steam until translucent and serve with sweet chili sauce.
description: Cho Muang is a delicate Thai flower-shaped dumpling made from butterfly pea dough and filled with minced pork and herbs. Its aromatic and elegant, often served at special occasions.

title: Chun Pia
ingredients: Spring roll wrappers + pork + vegetables + garlic
steps:
1. Fill thin wrappers with vegetables and minced pork.
2. Roll tightly and seal with flour paste.
3. Deep-fry until golden and serve with sweet chili sauce.
description: Chun Pia is a Thai-style fried spring roll filled with pork and vegetables. Its crispy, savory, and served with sweet chili sauce.

title: Salapao
ingredients: Flour + pork + sugar + yeast
steps:
1. Fill dough with seasoned pork mixture.
2. Steam until fluffy and fully cooked.
3. Serve warm with soy sauce.
description: Salapao is a Thai steamed bun filled with sweet or savory pork. Its soft, fluffy, and a favorite breakfast treat.

title: Soup Asa Ren
ingredients: Herbs + vegetables + egg + broth
steps:
1. Boil herbs and vegetables in broth.
2. Add beaten egg while stirring gently.
3. Simmer until egg sets and serve hot
description: Soup Asa Ren is a light Thai herb and egg soup with vegetables. Its fragrant, nutritious, and easy to prepare.

title: Dok Kung
ingredients: Shrimp + flour + garlic + chili
steps:
1. Mix minced shrimp with flour and seasonings.
2. Shape into small flower-like pieces.
3. Deep-fry until golden and serve with chili sauce.
description: Dok Kung is a Thai shrimp flower snack made with minced shrimp and flour, deep-fried until golden and crispy.

title: Thung Thong
ingredients: Flour wrappers + minced pork + vegetables + spring onion
steps:
1. Fill thin flour wrappers with minced pork and vegetables.
2. Tie with spring onion and deep-fry until crisp.
3. Serve hot with plum sauce.
description: Thung Thong is a Thai golden money bag appetizer filled with minced pork and vegetables, deep-fried until crisp and golden.

title: Nam Nang
ingredients: Coconut milk + agar powder + sugar
steps:
1. Mix coconut milk with agar powder and sugar.
2. Pour into molds and chill until set.
3. Serve cold as a refreshing snack.
description: Nam Nang is a Thai coconut jelly dessert made with coconut milk and agar. Its smooth, lightly sweet, and best served chilled.

title: Pla Haeng Tang Mo
ingredients: Dried fish + watermelon + shallots + chili
steps:
1. Shred dried fish and fry until crisp.
2. Serve over chilled watermelon cubes.
3. Sprinkle with fried shallots for extra flavor.
description: Pla Haeng Tang Mo is a Thai summer dish made from crispy dried fish and sweet watermelon, topped with fried shallots.

title: Pan Sip
ingredients: Flour + minced pork + garlic + pepper
steps:
1. Fill flour wrappers with minced pork or fish.
2. Fold and seal edges tightly.
3. Deep-fry until golden and cr
description: Pan Sip is a Thai fried dumpling filled with minced pork and herbs. Its golden, crispy, and served with a savory dip.

title: Pa Thong Ko
ingredients: Flour + sugar + yeast + oil
steps:
1. Mix flour, sugar, and yeast to make soft dough.
2. Shape and fry until puffed and golden.
3. Serve with sweet condensed milk or pandan custard.
description: Pa Thong Ko is a Thai fried donut made from sweet fermented dough. Its light, fluffy, and often eaten with pandan custard.

title: Poh Pia
ingredients: Flour wrappers + pork + glass noodles + vegetables
steps:
1. Fill wrappers with glass noodles, pork, and vegetables.
2. Roll tightly and seal edges.
3. Deep-fry until crisp and serve with chili sauce.
description: Poh Pia is a Thai crispy spring roll filled with pork, vegetables, and noodles. Its golden and delicious with chili sauce.

title: Mata Ba
ingredients: Flour + egg + vegetables + green onion
steps:
1. Mix flour and egg with chopped vegetables.
2. Pour mixture onto hot pan and fry both sides.
3. Serve with soy sauce or chili dip.
description: Mata Ba is a Thai vegetable pancake made from flour, egg, and mixed vegetables. Its crispy on the outside and soft inside.

title: Ma Uan
ingredients: Ripe Bananas + Coconut Milk + Sugar + Salt
steps: 1. Peel and slice bananas. 2. Boil coconut milk with sugar and salt. 3. Add bananas and simmer until tender.
description: A sweet Thai dessert of bananas cooked in creamy coconut milk.

title: Ma Ho
ingredients: Flour+sugar+pineapple
steps: 1. Cook minced pork with palm sugar, garlic, and coriander until thick. 2. Spoon on pineapple pieces.
description: A royal Thai appetizer with sweet-salty minced pork served on juicy pineapple.

title: Miang Kham
ingredients: Herbs+coconut+shrimp
steps: 1. Prepare all ingredients finely. 2. Wrap in betel leaves, drizzle sauce, and eat in one bite.
description: A traditional bite-sized snack with a mix of sweet, salty, sour, and spicy flavors.

title: La Tiang
ingredients: Minced Pork + Egg + Onion + Garlic + Palm Sugar + Soy Sauce
steps: 1. Cook pork mixture. 2. Make thin egg net and wrap filling inside.
description: A delicate royal snack with savory pork filling wrapped in a thin egg lattice.

title: Roti
ingredients: Flour+sugar+oil
steps: 1. Knead dough and rest. 2. Stretch and fry until golden. 3. Top with condensed milk.
description: A sweet and crispy Thai street roti often served with condensed milk or banana.

title: Loba
ingredients: Pork+herbs+spices
steps: 1. Clean and boil pork organs. 2. Fry with sauce mixture until flavorful.
description: A Phuket-style dish made with spiced fried pork organs and vinegar sauce.

title: Vihok Long Rang
ingredients: Fermented Fish + Garlic + Chili + Lime + Shallots
steps: 1. Mash fermented fish. 2. Mix with chili, lime, and shallots.
description: A strong-flavored fermented fish dip eaten with fresh vegetables.

title: Som Choon Yam
ingredients: Herbs+fruit+fish sauce
steps: 1. Mix all ingredients with dressing. 2. Garnish with herbs.
description: A refreshing Thai fruit salad with sweet and sour flavors.

title: Srong
ingredients: Rice Flour + Coconut Milk + Sugar + Pandan Juice
steps: 1. Mix ingredients. 2. Steam until firm. 3. Cut into pieces and serve.
description: A Thai dessert made from pandan-flavored rice flour and coconut milk.

title: Sate
ingredients: Meat+spices+peanut sauce
steps: 1. Marinate meat in coconut curry mix. 2. Grill and serve with peanut sauce.
description: Thai-style satay skewers served with creamy peanut sauce.

title: Saku
ingredients: Tapioca Pearls + Minced Pork + Peanuts + Garlic + Coriander
steps: 1. Cook tapioca dough. 2. Fill with savory pork mixture. 3. Steam until translucent.
description: A chewy and savory Thai snack of tapioca dumplings filled with seasoned pork.

title: Moo Takro
ingredients: Pork + Garlic + Pepper + Palm Sugar + Coconut Milk
steps: 1. Marinate pork. 2. Wrap in pandan leaves. 3. Grill until cooked.
description: A grilled pork dish wrapped in fragrant pandan leaves.

title: Moo Ping
ingredients: Pork+soy sauce+herbs
steps: 1. Marinate pork. 2. Skewer and grill until caramelized.
description: A famous Thai street food of grilled marinated pork skewers.

title: Rum
ingredients: Flour + Coconut Milk + Pandan + Sugar
steps: 1. Mix ingredients. 2. Steam in molds until cooked.
description: A soft Thai dessert often served in small flower-shaped molds.

title: Hoi Tak
ingredients: Mussels + Flour + Bean Sprouts + Egg + Garlic + Chili Sauce
steps: 1. Mix flour and mussels, fry in pan. 2. Add egg and bean sprouts.
description: A crispy Thai mussel pancake served with chili sauce.

title: Hoi Siab Jim Malakor
ingredients: Shellfish + Papaya + Chili + Lime + Fish Sauce
steps: 1. Steam shellfish. 2. Mix with papaya and spicy dressing.
description: A Thai-style shellfish salad with spicy papaya dressing.

title: A Pong
ingredients: Rice Flour + Coconut Milk + Sugar + Yeast
steps: 1. Mix and ferment batter. 2. Pour into molds and cook until crisp.
description: A thin, crispy Thai pancake with a soft center, popular in Phuket.

title: Otao
ingredients: Seafood + Flour + Bean Sprouts + Egg + Garlic + Soy Sauce
steps: 1. Mix seafood with flour and fry. 2. Add egg and bean sprouts.
description: A southern Thai-style seafood pancake similar to oyster omelet.

title: Hoi Jo
ingredients: Seafood + Flour + Bean Sprouts + Egg + Garlic + Soy Sauce
steps: 1. Mix filling and wrap in tofu skin. 2. Steam and deep fry.
description: A crispy golden roll of crab and pork wrapped in tofu skin, served with plum sauce.
